item.title: The World Bank has released its 2017 forecast for the Thai economy
item.description: The 2016 Thailand Economic Monitor, published today by the World Bank, projects Thailand’s economic growth to reach 3.1% in 2016 and 3.2% in 2017, surpassing the previous year’s 2.8%. The report identifies private consumption and public investments, such as rail infrastructure projects, as primary growth drivers. Tourism has also performed well in 2016, with tourist arrivals, particularly from China, rising by 13.1% in the third quarter. A temporary slowdown and economic inactivity following the passing of HM King Bhumibol Adulyadej in October are anticipated to be partially counterbalanced by year-end holiday tax incentives for shopping and domestic tourism.

item.title: Rights to due process and secondary protection
item.description: By Steve Peers The initial Common European Asylum System (CEAS) legislation defined ‘subsidiary protection,’ which protects individuals ineligible for refugee status but shouldn’t be returned to their home country. However, other initial CEAS legislation, particularly the asylum procedures Directive, didn’t cover those seeking subsidiary protection or clarify the connection between refugee and subsidiary protection statuses. This gap has been addressed in several ways. Firstly, future second-phase CEAS legislation fully applies to subsidiary protection applicants and defines the relationship between refugee and subsidiary protection statuses.

item.title: Part 1: The Legal Framework - Should the EU impose sanctions on its Member States for violations of the rule of law and human rights?
item.description: Professor Steve Peers, University of Essex As an EU law and human rights professor for over two decades, the topic of sanctioning Member States for human rights violations was once straightforward. The enforcement procedure (Article 7 TEU) was never used, making in-depth discussions unnecessary. My focus remained on practical issues like arrest warrants and asylum seekers. However, the landscape has shifted. Like Article 50, which also addresses the EU’s relationship with Member States, Article 7 seems hastily drafted without considering its practical application, possibly because its creators never anticipated its use.

item.title: The Great Repeal Bill and the Legacy of Henry VIII: Threatening Rights
item.description: Joelle Grogan, Lecturer, Middlesex University The Great Repeal Bill is ironically named because it won’t actually repeal much EU law. Instead, when Brexit concludes, it will initially shift existing EU law into British law. While this maintains some stability during the transition, the bill also includes a concerning element: a Henry VIII clause. This clause, named after the king who gave himself sweeping legislative power, allows the government to alter primary legislation with minimal parliamentary scrutiny.

This move aims to reduce operating costs like utilities and cleaning for CAG and its partners while optimizing resource allocation across the airport’s terminals. Starting May 1, 2020, Terminal 2 (T2) will halt operations for 18 months, relocating airlines to other terminals*.

item.description: Dateline: 27 January 2017 David The Good’s latest book, Push The Zone, is out now on Amazon. I finished reading it this morning and really enjoyed it (Click Here for details). It also won’t help with your dating life, but you probably already knew that.

item.title: Singaporean IT leaders are concerned that a shortage of skills could impede the progress of the Smart Nation initiative
item.description: 93% of Singaporean Chief Information Officers (CIOs) are worried that Singapore lacks the IT talent pool needed to successfully implement Smart Nation initiatives. Six out of 10 CIOs believe Smart Nation initiatives will lead to more IT jobs, and 53% believe these initiatives will boost average IT salaries. New independent research* commissioned by specialized recruiter Robert Half reveals that over 9 in 10 (93%) Singaporean IT leaders are concerned about the lack of readily available IT talent in Singapore to build a Smart Nation-ready workforce.

item.title: Caution: Superman is poisonous
item.description: According to a McAfee blog post, Superman poses a significant online threat. The company argues that the widespread presence of superheroes beyond comic books allows hackers and scammers to exploit them for cybercrime. McAfee’s survey, which used their SiteAdvisor site ratings, revealed that Superman is the “Most Toxic Superhero.” The study found that searches combining “Superman” with terms like “free torrent download,” “watch,” “free app,” and “online” have a 16.5% chance of leading to websites containing threats like spyware, adware, spam, phishing, viruses, and other malware.

item.title: HP has announced a new promotion offering free roaming Wi-Fi for specific notebooks and tablets
item.description: HP and iPass, the largest Wi-Fi network globally, recently revealed a partnership. Select HP laptops and tablets will now offer access to the iPass network. Source: HP website. This collaboration aims to provide users in Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ) with easier and more budget-friendly internet access both locally and during their travels. Customers purchasing new HP laptops and tablets with this feature will enjoy automatic access to millions of hotspots on the iPass network for a year, free of charge, upon registration.

item.title: How the EU Migration and Asylum Pact Can Address its Blind Spot on Statelessness
item.description: Chris Nash, the Director of the European Network on Statelessness, highlights their recent analysis of the EU Pact on Migration and Asylum. The analysis focuses on how the European Commission’s proposals within the Pact could affect the fundamental rights of stateless migrants and refugees. It offers suggestions for addressing these concerns during Pact negotiations and implementation. The Pact, as it stands, fails to directly address the rights of stateless individuals or offer solutions to the specific protection issues they encounter.

item.title: Brexit and the trade relations between the European Union and the United Kingdom with other countries.
item.description: Some Brexit supporters have a relaxed view of European Union (EU) law. However, their assertions about trade after Brexit, specifically the notion that existing agreements would simply continue, require closer examination. They argue that global trade regulations would prevent the EU from hindering the UK’s trade relationships. This overlooks the possibility that, absent a transitional agreement, the UK’s participation in the World Trade Organisation (WTO) and other trade agreements could be at risk.

item.title: DED allows for the licensing of eight additional business activities
item.description: Source: DED. Bushahab. Dubai’s Department of Economic Development (DED) has expanded its list of permissible business activities, increasing the total to 2,133. This decision stems from regular feedback gathered from various industry sectors regarding local market needs and the balance of supply and demand. The goal is to simplify business operations and offer essential resources for growth. The new additions encompass several specialized activities. These include assembling industrial robots, providing tax consultancy services, printing secure documents, manufacturing scanners, collecting and transporting hazardous waste, offering health consultancy, brokering financing deals, and developing and managing applications for social media.

item.title: Adobe and Microsoft software will now collaborate more effectively
item.description: Adobe has enhanced Adobe Document Cloud as part of their partnership with Microsoft. Both companies want to provide excellent digital document experiences to their many shared customers. Adobe Sign is now more integrated with Microsoft Dynamics 365. This provides real-time access to customer information from LinkedIn Sales Navigator and allows for more automated sales processes. New PDF integrations will enable all Office 365 users who subscribe to Adobe Acrobat DC for teams or enterprises to create, edit, and view secure, high-quality PDFs.

item.title: Vote MPLS & Ethernet for Better Bandwidth
item.description: The 2008 election season is upon us. To determine which candidates best serve your interests, we suggest considering MPLS and Ethernet for reliable bandwidth, improved performance, and reduced costs over 1-3 years. Let’s delve into their platforms to see if they deserve your vote. IP Networking is currently the leading technology. Initially confined to local offices, IP has expanded to WANs at state, regional, and national levels. Today, almost all network designs are centered around IP or Internet Protocol.

item.title: Sipping on the Trunk Lines
item.description: The history of telephone trunks goes back to the early days of telephones. Trunks are lines that carry multiple phone conversations, initially connecting switchboards and switching offices. They’ve evolved from wire bundles to analog and now digital circuits, with T1, ISDN PRI, DS3, and SONET being common digital trunking services. However, SIP trunking is emerging as a popular alternative. Telephone trunking saves money by combining multiple phone lines into a single high-bandwidth connection.

item.title: The launch of Fairfield by Marriott Belitung has been announced
item.description: Marriott International has expanded its Fairfield by Marriott brand with the opening of a new hotel in Belitung, Indonesia. Source: Fairfield by Marriott Belitung website. The Fairfield by Marriott Belitung. Mike Fulkerson, Vice President of Brand & Marketing for Marriott International Asia Pacific, stated that Fairfield by Marriott is experiencing rapid growth in the region, with 47 properties in development in Asia Pacific and over 400 globally. He highlighted the brand’s focus on providing a relaxing and dependable experience at a good value, enhanced by Indonesian hospitality, making the Belitung location an ideal retreat for travelers.

item.description: We apologize, but the Samsung D307 is no longer available. To explore the latest cell phone deals and free phone offers, use our convenient Cell Phone Plan Finder. The Samsung D307 combines the functionality of a computer, phone, and personal stenographer. This phone is perfect for those who prioritize messaging. While many phones offer texting, it’s often cumbersome due to limited keys and multiple functions. Alternatively, bulky PDA-style phones are available but not pocket-friendly.

item.title: A Thousand VARs Can't Be Wrong
item.description: Telarus, the parent company of Shop For T1 and the VAR Network, has recruited over 1,000 Value Added Resellers (VARs), according to Chief Technical Officer Patrick Oborn. This is a significant achievement in the telecommunications industry, which is characterized by independent small businesses. The key motivators for telephone system installers and network consultants to join this nationwide database are customer leads and residual income. Businesses specializing in computer network and telephone sales and service usually operate locally or regionally.

item.title: A Pair of Beomaster 1900 Receivers for Restoration: Capacitor Replacement on Unit #2
item.description: The first Beomaster 1900 receiver is fully operational and undergoing testing in a listening room. However, the second unit still requires restoration. Initial assessment of the second Beomaster 1900 has already been completed, and now it’s time to begin replacing capacitors on the main circuit board. The main circuit board houses most of the capacitors that need replacing. Unfortunately, it cannot be removed for servicing and must remain connected to the wire harness.

item.title: European academics are appealing for the EU to avoid becoming a lawless zone.
item.description: The situation at the Polish-Belarusian border briefly gained public awareness, with images of suffering refugees stranded in terrible conditions sparking outrage. While there were discussions and reactions, the humanitarian crisis persists. Since September 2021, the Polish government has restricted access to the border zone, putting migrants in danger and denying aid organizations access. People are facing dire circumstances, including death, due to lack of basic necessities and medical help.

item.title: Increase Bandwidth Without Increasing Costs
item.description: Companies need more bandwidth, especially for their wide area networks (WANs), but it can be very expensive. While high speeds are affordable within a company’s LAN, connecting to the outside world traditionally comes with much higher costs. This is because WAN connections were typically provided by telecom companies using technology initially meant for phone services. While more modern providers have entered the market with updated infrastructure, even traditional providers are adapting to the demand for data services.

item.title: It's Wireless Cleanup Time Again
item.description: This New Year’s, consider a resolution that benefits both your wallet and the environment: declutter your old cell phones! It’s common to accumulate unused phones after upgrading contracts or switching carriers. Technological advancements and tempting free offers often lead us to replace phones before they’re truly unusable. While understandable, this habit results in drawers and boxes filled with neglected devices. These phones quickly lose value and often end up discarded, contributing to electronic waste and releasing harmful substances like lead and cadmium into landfills.

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5503): A New Arrival from California
item.description: I recently acquired a Beogram 4002 (Type 5503; AC platter motor) turntable for restoration. The unit arrived in remarkably good shape. The dust cover is practically flawless, and the aluminum panels and platter are in fantastic condition. However, there is a hole drilled into the top left corner of the aluminum plate surrounding the platter, meaning this part will need replacement. Thankfully, beneath the plates, the turntable appears to be in pristine, original condition.

item.title: Examining the Reunification of Ireland from an EU Legal Viewpoint
item.description: Nikos Skoutaris, Lecturer in EU law at the University of East Anglia; website on Secessions, Constitutions and EU law. When the UK voted to leave the EU on June 23, 2016, Northern Ireland voted to remain. This result has led Sinn Féin to call for a referendum on Irish unification, which would allow Northern Ireland to stay in the EU. This discussion has gained momentum following the most recent Northern Ireland Assembly election, which saw a significant decrease in the Unionist vote.

item.title: Shared Internet Service for Apartment Buildings
item.description: Property owners and managers are recognizing the increasing importance of broadband internet access, much like essential utilities. They are exploring ways to provide this service, similar to phone and cable companies. Offering high-speed internet can be a significant advantage in attracting and retaining tenants. Becoming an internet service provider, even for a single building, requires reliable, dedicated internet access. T1 or Dedicated Internet provides this, ensuring the full bandwidth is dedicated to your use, unlike shared services like DSL and Cable.

item.title: Dial-Up is Alive and Kicking
item.description: In today’s world of high-speed internet, it might seem strange to talk about dial-up. Many people consider it outdated technology. However, dial-up internet access is still relevant. Millions of people still use and appreciate it for browsing the internet and checking emails. This “outdated” technology remains profitable. One of the main advantages of dial-up is its affordability. Unlimited access is available for a low monthly cost, making it a budget-friendly option compared to DSL or cable internet.

item.title: Azerai offers affordable luxury in Vietnam
item.description: Azerai invites discerning travelers to experience attainable luxury in Vietnam through a collection of acclaimed boutique resorts. Founded by Adrian Zecha, the visionary behind Aman Resorts, the Azerai concept is already present in the culturally rich destinations of Ke Ga, Can Tho, and Hue. Source: Azerai. item.title: Consumer Card achieves outstanding success, according to DIB's report
item.description: Source: DIB website. Banner for the Consumer Card page. The Consumer Card, a collaboration between the Department of Economic Development (DED) in Dubai and Dubai Islamic Bank (DIB), the largest Islamic bank in the UAE, has surpassed expectations in a very competitive market by the close of 2016. This success highlights how much customers value the card’s transparency and customer-centric approach. Customers appreciate the card’s straightforward rewards system, which focuses on everyday transactions rather than requiring increased spending.

item.title: The demand for milk and yogurt-based beverages is increasing in Indonesia
item.description: Increased advertising in mass media, along with more television shows and magazine content focused on health topics, have made Indonesian consumers more aware of the advantages of drinking milk from 2011 to 2016, according to Euromonitor. Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company leads the drinking milk market, holding a 23% value share in 2016. Its most recognized brand is Ultra. Euromonitor attributes the company’s success in flavored milk to its strong marketing and enhanced distribution.

item.title: Is Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union considered valid?
item.description: Bartlomiej Kulpa, LLM (London), PhD Candidate (Amsterdam) @KulpaBart Introduction The Treaty of Lisbon introduced Article 50 to the Treaty on European Union (TEU), establishing the legal framework for exiting the European Union (EU). This article acknowledges the possibility of withdrawal, a concept many legal experts believed existed even before the Treaty of Lisbon. Article 50 TEU outlines the withdrawal procedure. However, some argue that it contradicts the EU’s fundamental nature and weakens member states’ commitment to European integration, raising questions about the ideal withdrawal mechanism.

item.title: Copper WAN Bandwidth Headed to 500 Mbps
item.description: Ericsson has developed a new technology that could significantly boost data transmission speeds over existing copper wire infrastructure. This innovation allows for WAN connections over copper, achieving speeds up to 500 Mbps. While Gigabit Ethernet is achievable with Cat-6 wiring for LAN connections, this technology focuses on connecting businesses to broadband providers using existing copper infrastructure. This is significant because many businesses require increased bandwidth for various purposes, including server farms, internet access, data transfer between locations, and the growing need for electronic medical record transfers.

item.title: In 2017, a settlement network powered by blockchain announced that it would waive fees for transfers to Singapore
item.description: OKLink, a global settlement platform, has introduced the first entirely free remittance corridor. The company stated that transfers up to US$100,000 each month to Singapore will be free throughout 2017. Previously, OKLink applied a 0.1% fee on cross-border payments to Singapore, while other companies might charge up to US$5 per transaction. “As the world’s largest blockchain-powered global settlement network, we can process cross-border payments faster and more affordably as more partners join,” explained Jack Liu, Chief Strategy Officer at OKLink.

item.title: E-Rate Supports Gigabit Internet for Schools & Libraries
item.description: By: John Shepler It’s evident that broadband internet access is crucial for businesses, education, and individuals. Schools and libraries, in particular, require online access to thrive in today’s digital age. Schools & Libraries are Lagging Surprisingly, many elementary schools and libraries lack adequate internet access. They require modern broadband speeds, surpassing the outdated megabit per second standard. Today’s requirements necessitate fiber optic connections. The FCC acknowledges this need, promoting internet speeds of at least 100 Mbps per 1,000 users for schools and libraries, with plans to increase this to 1,000 Mbps.

item.title: Get Ready For The Recovery With Bandwidth on Demand
item.description: The economy is recovering, benefiting some businesses while others struggle. Maintaining earnings through cost-cutting instead of increased sales won’t be sustainable. When the economy fully recovers, rapid adaptation will be crucial, but increased expenses are only justifiable with increased revenue. Bandwidth on demand offers a solution. Bandwidth on demand allows businesses to access and pay for only the bandwidth they currently need, scaling usage up or down as required. This differs from the traditional approach of installing full capacity in advance, which poses financial risks if projected growth doesn’t materialize.

item.title: The CJEU revives the old 'third pillar' with the EU Zombie Law.
item.description: Steve Peers In 1993, the Maastricht Treaty’s implementation brought about the EU’s adoption of criminal law and policing measures under a unique system known as the ’third pillar’ of EU law. Although modified by the Treaty of Amsterdam in 1999 and facing multiple attempts at its abolishment over the following decade, it persisted until the Treaty of Lisbon, which formally ended it upon coming into effect on December 1, 2009, albeit with a five-year transitional period.

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Installation of New Gold Plated RCA Plugs
item.description: Replacing the original DIN or RCA plugs is a crucial step when restoring a Beogram 4002. The old plugs often show corrosion due to the lack of gold plating. Upgrading to modern, all-metal plugs with gold-plated terminals is recommended. This upgrade minimizes electromagnetic interference and ensures optimal signal transfer to the amplifier by maintaining low contact resistance, especially important for the delicate MMC20 cartridge signals. The original RCA plugs on a Beogram 4002 (5513) being restored were in poor condition.

item.title: The Bleisure app emerged as the winner of the Sabre hackathon
item.description: Source: Sabre. From left: Isolda Josy and Pranay Roy, Moments; Mendis from Sabre Travel Network Asia Pacific; and Marco Angeles, Moments. A team from Singapore won the 24-hour Destination Hack: Singapore, Sabre’s inaugural Asia Pacific hackathon. Participants were tasked with designing a new technology app that could revolutionize travel – from planning and booking to the overall experience. The winning app, Moments, caters to the increasing demand for “bleisure” travel in the Asia Pacific region.

item.description: My work on restoring the 4002 continues, and today involved polishing the hood – a task that’s quite a workout! item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Replacing the RPM Indicator Light Bulbs with LEDs
item.description: During the restoration of a Beogram 4002 (5513), the incandescent bulbs in the RPM indicator panels were replaced with LED-based alternatives. This change aimed to enhance the stability of the DC motor control system by reducing heat generation, a common issue with traditional bulbs. The new SMD LED circuits, designed for a seamless drop-in replacement, feature red and green LEDs calibrated to mimic the warm glow of incandescent lighting. This spectrum, especially the inclusion of red photons, ensures accurate illumination of the red plastic RPM indicators.

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5514): First Impressions
item.description: A Beogram 4002, model 5514, recently arrived in its original packaging, complete with styrofoam, which is remarkable! The platter was separately packaged in a vinyl box for added protection. The turntable is in excellent cosmetic condition, requiring only cleaning. Even the keypad is in good shape, though using a 4002 Commander remote control could help prevent future wear. The veneer corners are flawless, and the internal components appear untouched. Initial testing showed the turntable powers on and the motor functions, but the arm doesn’t lower.

item.title: HTC introduces smartphone and imaging ecosystem components in Singapore
item.description: HTC debuted its new camera, the RE, alongside the HTC Desire EYE smartphone, HTC Eye Experience imaging software, and Zoe, a collaborative video editing community, in Singapore. Jack Yang, President of South Asia, HTC Corporation, stated that similar to how HTC allowed people to replace laptops with smartphones in 1997, HTC is again revolutionizing technology by offering powerful hardware coupled with exceptional software. He emphasized HTC’s aim to change the way we perceive imaging — taking users beyond the viewfinder and placing them in the midst of the action with innovative software that enhances the use of technology.

item.title: Visualizations in the style of Tableau help to make content more memorable
item.description: Ben Jones, Director of Marketing, Outreach Programs at Tableau Software, highlights the numerous advantages of data visualizations for content creators. During a media workshop introducing Tableau Public, a free version of Tableau’s visualization platform, Jones outlined several key benefits: Data visualizations are attention-grabbing, providing a visual anchor within text and effectively conveying the story’s central theme. They simplify the presentation of trends compared to using words alone. Visualizations make comparisons clear and effortless.

item.title: Cloud vs Premises Contact Center Costs
item.description: Lots of small businesses can get by with just a local or toll-free number for customer calls. But as companies grow, they usually dedicate staff and resources to handle customer interactions, creating a dedicated department known as a contact center. While contact centers are important, they can be expensive to run. Is there a way to reduce the cost? Until recently, outsourcing to different locations was an option, but that often led to issues with language barriers and inconsistent service quality.

item.title: Ethernet Over Copper Vs T1
item.description: The T1 line is a widely available and dependable business bandwidth solution. It provides dedicated bandwidth at a reasonable cost, making it a reliable choice. However, another service called Ethernet over Copper (EoC) is gaining popularity as a viable alternative. EoC is an Ethernet WAN connection that can connect multiple business locations or provide a dedicated high-speed Ethernet connection. It can also serve as an access point to private cloud networks, including national and international MPLS networks.

item.title: The Dark Side of Spectrum Renewal
item.description: Half a century ago, the government embraced urban renewal, demolishing and rebuilding deteriorated urban areas for housing projects or highways leading to suburbs. Similarly, today, we’re witnessing “spectrum renewal,” where sections of the radio frequency spectrum are deemed too valuable for older technologies like analog TV and cell phone service, despite their widespread use. This isn’t driven by lack of public demand. Millions of analog TV sets and cell phones are still functional.

item.title: Beogram 4000: Installation of a Neutrik Gold Plated DIN5 Plug
item.description: A common improvement for the Beogram 4000 is replacing the DIN5 plug with a gold-plated version. The older plugs, often corroded, benefit from the upgrade. This particular Beogram 4000 was no exception. Here’s a comparison of the old plug and the new, gleaming Neutrik plug (Newark 27B4483): The old plug was removed, and the cable was prepped for the new plug. Stripping the outer insulation to this length works well:

item.title: CLEAR Sailing for 4G Wireless
item.description: You’re hearing a lot about 4G wireless technology, but did you know that CLEAR is already rolling out its 4G WiMAX network? If you happen to live in an area where CLEAR WiMAX is currently offered, you can experience internet speeds comparable to DSL or Cable, all without the need for physical wires. They have a range of plans to suit your needs, whether it’s for your home, mobile device, or both.

item.title: Your Point to Point Ethernet Connection
item.description: Businesses with multiple locations often need to share data, traditionally relying on T1 lines for connectivity. While multiple T1 lines can increase bandwidth, this approach might not be the most cost-effective solution, especially in metropolitan areas. Point-to-point Ethernet offers a compelling alternative, often at a lower cost per Mbps, particularly for higher bandwidth needs. Ethernet streamlines data transmission by maintaining its format throughout the network, potentially allowing locations to function as a single bridged LAN.

item.title: The future was examined at the GREAT Festival of Innovation in Hong Kong
item.description: The second day of the GREAT Festival of Innovation in Hong Kong brought together over 50 prominent figures from various industries to discuss the future of living. The event, which ran until March 24th, featured experts, business leaders, and creatives sharing their insights with attendees from around the world. With a focus on the prediction that 70% of the global population will reside in urban areas by 2050, the festival examined the implications for how we live, eat, travel, and interact with the natural world through panels and demonstrations.

item.title: Orchard Road in Singapore is adorned with Christmas lights
item.description: Singapore’s Orchard Road is aglow with Disney magic this holiday season. The “Disney Magical Moments — Christmas on A Great Street!” celebration features illuminated displays of beloved characters. The lights were officially switched on the evening of November 10. Here’s a glimpse of the Toy Story-themed lights outside Plaza Singapura from the opening night. On October 19th, Qasr Al Muwaiji (Al Muwaiji Palace) hosted the Bisht Workshop, which delved into the history of the traditional garment worn by UAE rulers and the unique patterns associated with each ruler. Attendees also participated in a hands-on workshop, learning to create their own bisht.

item.title: Is the draft renegotiation deal a legitimate rejection? Tusk's suggestion and the role of national parliaments.
item.description: Dr. Katarzyna Granat, Junior Research Fellow & Marie Curie Fellow, Durham Law School Donald Tusk’s “A New Settlement for the United Kingdom within the European Union” (Draft Decision of the Heads of State or Government), presented on February 2, 2016, provides an initial concrete outline for enhancing the role of national parliaments within the UK’s renegotiation efforts. This note compares the proposed changes with existing mechanisms under the Lisbon Treaty.

item.title: Farewell, VB
item.description: We’ve been close since I started with programming on my Commodore 64. From creating basic applications in school to more complex projects later on, you were there. We tackled various challenges, from writing a Windows application for a psychology thesis to automating tasks with WordPerfect macros. You adapted well to new environments, proving valuable in Microsoft Office VBA and early ERP systems. Our journey continued with web applications, e-commerce integrations, and custom desktop apps.

item.title: Is Brexit Causing the British Mind to Close? The Impact on EU Academics and Government Guidance
item.description: Steve Peers The Brexit vote is often seen as an attack on both academic expertise and EU citizens in the UK, whether accurate or not. These two issues intersect in a recent dispute involving the Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) and the London School of Economics (LSE). The FCO allegedly barred EU citizens from advising the government on Brexit, though the details are unclear. The LSE reportedly informed staff that the FCO no longer sought Brexit advice from EU nationals, sparking a controversy that made its way to social media and prominent news outlets like The Guardian.

item.title: The financial consequences of the COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: Blockchain’s potential in fostering trust within networks is significant. The World Bank Group has been actively supporting clients throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. William Zhang, a Lead Information Security Architect and Blockchain Specialist at the World Bank Group, highlighted the severe economic impact of COVID-19, including a US$4 trillion global GDP decline, significant job losses, and numerous business closures. Zhang, speaking at a webinar titled “Leveraging Blockchain Innovations to Cope with the COVID-19 New Normal,” organized by the 10x1000 Tech for Inclusion Programme, noted that projections indicate a 9% increase in both poverty and extreme poverty.

item.title: VoIP Comparison Shopping
item.description: Voice over IP (VoIP) is becoming increasingly popular for both home and business phone service. With this new technology rapidly evolving, it’s hard to keep up with the latest companies and deals. If you’re looking to switch to VoIP or simply want a better deal, you need a way to compare your options. That’s where a comparison shopping service comes in handy, allowing you to easily evaluate available services and choose the best fit.

item.title: Business Ethernet Vs T1
item.description: For decades, small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) have relied heavily on T1 lines. However, a new service called Business Ethernet is emerging as a strong competitor, offering comparable performance at a lower cost. Business Ethernet, also referred to as Metro Ethernet, Ethernet over Copper, or Ethernet over Fiber, provides advantages such as scalable bandwidth options, reduced cost per Mbps, and wider availability. Its name emphasizes that Ethernet is no longer limited to Local Area Networks (LANs) and carriers, as it’s rapidly being adopted by SMBs.

item.title: Hosting Nation Offers Low Cost Web Hosting For Everyone
item.description: Are you searching for the perfect balance of affordability and quality in web hosting? Look no further than Hosting Nation. Gone are the days of expensive, self-managed servers. Hosting services have become incredibly affordable, allowing you to establish a global presence for less than ten dollars a month. If you’re tired of “free” hosting services that compromise your website’s aesthetics or expensive “professional” hosting plans, Hosting Nation offers a compelling alternative.

item.title: Euromonitor outlines four key pillars for a successful expansion into emerging markets
item.description: Euromonitor International, a global market research firm, has published an e-book titled “Succeed in Emerging Markets: Selection, Strategy and First Steps”. This e-book presents a four-pillar model designed to guide businesses entering emerging markets. The first pillar, “market,” examines macroeconomic stability, consumer market size, growth, and openness. The second pillar, “population,” delves into demographics to help businesses assess how their products or services align with the competitive landscape. The third pillar, “access,” evaluates the ease of market entry.

item.title: Flat Rate vs Pay As You Go Conference Calling
item.description: You’ve already seen how conference calls and web conferencing can save your company a lot of money. So why worry about the small costs involved? Firstly, saving money is always a good thing. Secondly, the more affordable conference calls are, the more you can use them to boost productivity. Let’s examine AccuConference, a leading teleconferencing provider, and see their pricing options. AccuConference offers both flat rate and pay-as-you-go conference calls.

item.title: Using eConnect to import Analytical Accounting data
item.description: Steve Endow, a Microsoft MVP for Dynamics GP, shares his insights on troubleshooting eConnect integrations, particularly when importing Dynamics GP transactions that include Analytical Accounting distributions. Users successfully importing transactions might find that the associated Analytical Accounting data is missing in GP. This issue often stems from incorrect import procedures and misleading error messages from eConnect. To clarify, this article outlines how to correctly include Analytical Accounting data in an eConnect import.

item.title: Life is full of challenges, and then you have to deal with the third extension of EU membership.
item.description: Professor Steve Peers, University of Essex This extension was unexpected. Despite the Benn Act, which mandated the Prime Minister to request a three-month extension for EU membership if Parliament failed to approve a withdrawal agreement by October 19, the Prime Minister insisted he would rather resign than comply. Fueled by ambiguous sources within Downing Street, there was persistent speculation that the Benn Act was unconstitutional, riddled with loopholes, would be superseded by emergency powers, or violated EU law.

item.title: Creating a RESTful JSON web service integration for Dynamics GP - Part 1
item.description: Steve Endow, a Microsoft MVP for Dynamics GP and a Dynamics GP Certified IT Professional based in Los Angeles, recently completed a fascinating Dynamics GP integration project. This project involved creating a RESTful JSON web service that enables a website to seamlessly integrate with Dynamics GP, Authorize.net, and the k-eCommerce/Azox Credit Card Extension. Given its role in handling sensitive credit card data, the web service prioritizes security by incorporating HMAC authentication, AES encryption, and operating exclusively over HTTPS.

item.title: Cloud Hosting vs VPS
item.description: Virtual Private Servers (VPS) offer a hosting solution for websites that have outgrown shared hosting but aren’t ready for the cost and responsibility of a fully dedicated server. However, a new option allows for flexible scaling and a pay-as-you-go model: cloud server hosting. Discussions about cloud computing versus managing your own data center are becoming increasingly common. However, many companies haven’t reached the stage where investing in a complete in-house data center is necessary.

item.title: The Hasso Plattner Institute is offering a free six-week MOOC on the Internet
item.description: The Hasso Plattner Institute (HPI) is offering a free, six-week online course in English about the fundamentals of the Internet. Starting on March 31st, HPI’s director, Professor Christoph Meinel, will teach participants about the technical basis of the Internet through a massive open online course (MOOC) titled “Introduction to Internetworking with TCP/IP.” The course is available to anyone and can be accessed through free registration. Professor Meinel believes that anyone who uses the Internet for daily tasks like online shopping, reading news articles, or sending emails should understand the technologies that make these actions possible.

item.title: Do Dynamics GP upgrades still require a test environment?
item.description: Steve Endow, a Microsoft MVP for Dynamics GP, discusses the necessity of a test environment for “typical” Dynamics GP upgrades. He observes that while some customers have complex setups requiring thorough testing, many others have simpler environments where upgrading directly in production might be feasible. Endow acknowledges that GP upgrades in the past were often complicated, necessitating a separate test server. However, he notes that Microsoft’s acquisition of Dynamics GP led to a streamlined and more reliable upgrade process.

item.title: The EC is proposing an AI Liability Directive to provide assistance.
item.description: Ida Varošanec (PhD student, University of Groningen) and Nynke Vellinga (post-doc researcher, University of Groningen) Photo credit: Cryteria, via Wikimedia commons 1. Proposal Goals The European Commission’s proposal for an AI Liability Directive, published on September 28, 2022, alongside an updated Product Liability Directive, aims to address the risks posed by artificial intelligence (AI) while acknowledging its potential benefits. The proposal stems from a report recognizing the potential harm AI systems can cause due to their connectivity, unpredictable nature, and opacity, which makes it difficult to assign responsibility for AI-related incidents.

item.title: Tea Forté Singapore presents three mooncake collections as part of the Autumn in Abundance series
item.description: Source: Tea Forté. item.title: Styletag is known for identifying the latest fashion trends globally
item.description: Want to stay stylish at work? South Korea’s SK Planet has refreshed its Styletag mobile app using trends from New York Fashion Week, which wrapped up on February 13th. Source: Styletag page at the Play Store Styletag gathers and organizes user-submitted fashion content worldwide, offering both style inspiration and shopping details. The app includes contributions from professional photographers, amateur enthusiasts, and invited fashion experts. This free app is compatible with iOS 7 (iPad, iPhone, and iPod) via iTunes and Android devices through the Google Play store.

item.title: Do crime victims now have additional rights under EU law?
item.description: Steve Peers* *This analysis is taken from the upcoming 4th edition of EU Justice and Home Affairs Law Victims of crime are often disheartened not just by the crime itself but also by the criminal justice system’s indifference to their needs. To tackle this issue, the EU introduced a Directive on crime victims’ rights in 2012 that Member States were required to implement by November 16, 2015. This law supersedes an earlier Framework Decision on this matter from 2001.

item.title: There will be an increase in cyberattacks in the Asia Pacific region in 2015
item.description: A new cybersecurity report from Trend Micro predicts that criminals will increasingly target retail and financial institutions outside the United States in 2015. The report, Trend Micro Security Predictions for 2015 and Beyond: The Invisible Becomes Visible, anticipates a rise in targeted attacks, specifically in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region. These attacks focus on infiltrating a specific organization to obtain valuable data. High-profile attacks in the US and China demonstrate that cybercriminals favor these targeted attacks to gather intelligence, including financial data, personal information, classified government data, and intellectual property like blueprints.

item.title: The FastGig app has been released to connect flexible workers with job opportunities
item.description: FastCo, the company known for its Asian non-executive job platform FastJobs, has launched FastGig, an app designed for the expanding gig economy. FastCo claims this is one of the first apps specifically for gig workers in Southeast Asia. FastGig, operating as Singapore’s first workforce-as-a-service (WaaS) platform, connects skilled flexible workers with companies facing staffing shortages, particularly during peak seasons. Julian Tan, FastCo’s Founder & CEO, highlights FastGig as a solution to a significant market gap, providing flexibility for both workers and businesses and transforming Singapore’s gig economy.

item.title: VoIP Without The Internet
item.description: Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) emerged as an alternative telephone service that utilizes existing broadband connections for both internet and phone services. This allows providers to bypass fees associated with leasing traditional copper phone lines, leading to more attractive bundled packages for customers. Theoretically, the internet’s capacity should easily accommodate low-bandwidth voice data. However, this isn’t always the case in reality. Internet paths, much like highways, can become congested, leading to bandwidth constraints, transmission delays (latency), and dropped data packets, all of which disrupt real-time communication like phone calls.

item.title: Identifying SQL Server Users without a Corresponding Login
item.description: Let’s imagine two situations: First, you set up a test Dynamics GP server for a client by installing SQL Server and Dynamics GP, then restoring database copies. Second, a client’s Dynamics GP SQL server crashes, you rebuild it, and restore databases from backups. Both scenarios present a common problem: restoring a database from one SQL Server to another doesn’t transfer the associated SQL Server logins. Scenario 1 offers a solution: a “Capture Logins” script (KB 878449) efficiently transfers SQL logins to the new server.

item.title: Beogram 4000: A New Arrival From Massachusetts - First Look
item.description: A Beogram 4000 turntable arrived from a Massachusetts customer for a complete restoration. Thankfully, it was properly packaged and arrived without damage. The turntable’s dust cover shows typical signs of use, but it will be replaced with a new one. The aluminum surfaces are in good shape overall. However, there are some minor flaws. The keypad has a corner ding, suggesting it might have come loose during past transportation. Additionally, there are small scratches on the aluminum, possibly from the keypad moving around.

item.title: Clarification on Dual Citizens and EU Citizenship by the ECJ
item.description: Professor Steve Peers A fundamental principle within EU law concerning the freedom of movement posits that it primarily pertains to EU citizens residing in a Member State different from their home country. Consequently, EU citizens residing in their own Member State cannot generally invoke this law. However, ECJ case law sometimes permits them to assert rights based on their EU citizenship. This begs the question: what happens to citizens of two Member States?

item.title: SQL script for verifying Dynamics GP GL batch control totals
item.description: A customer encountered a bug in their Dynamics GP integration that caused discrepancies between the actual number of imported GL transactions and the batch control totals. To identify these discrepancies, a SQL query was created to compare the number of GL transactions and JE totals with the batch control totals stored in SY00500. The query utilizes a Common Table Expression (CTE) to efficiently calculate and compare the data. This approach helps pinpoint differences between the expected transaction count and total amount against the recorded batch control totals.

item.title: Upgrade Your Business Image
item.description: Your image as a business professional is largely controlled by your company when you work for a large corporation. However, as a small business owner, independent sales agent, or consultant, you are responsible for managing your own image. One important aspect of this is your business card. The design and printing of your business card contribute to a polished and professional look, but an unprofessional email address can quickly ruin that impression.

item.title: ShoreTel Connect CLOUD Goes Way Beyond VoIP
item.description: VoIP phone systems are often viewed as a direct substitute for conventional analog business phone systems, encompassing Key Telephone and PBX systems. The transition to this modern technology eliminates the need for separate phone and computer networks and allows businesses to move their internal switching system to the cloud. Moreover, switching to IP phones unlocks a wider array of features, often referred to as Unified Communications (UC). ShorTel, a recognized leader in business communications, is widely used by companies of all sizes.

item.title: The EU Return Directive has been implemented by the European Parliament to bring the EU expulsion policy in line with recommendations from UN human rights expert mechanisms.
item.description: Izabella Majcher, PhD in International Law; Senior Legal Officer, ECRE* *The views expressed in the post are those of the author and do not necessarily reflect the position of ECRE In December 2020, the European Parliament issued a Resolution regarding the implementation of the Return Directive (a 2008 directive concerning the rules for returning undocumented migrants). This Resolution resulted from the European Commission’s failure to assess the Directive’s implementation, a task they were supposed to perform every three years starting in 2013.

item.title: The Connection that's Missing: The Impact of Direct Effect, CETA/TTIP, and Investor-State Dispute Settlement
item.description: By Daniel Thym, Chair of Public, European and International Law, University of Konstanz International trade agreements, particularly the proposed deals between the EU and the US (TTIP) and Canada (CETA), have garnered significant public interest. However, many legal professionals and students lack familiarity with this area of law and often apply domestic legal concepts to the international arena. For instance, there’s an assumption that national courts can enforce international trade rules and that companies can challenge state actions under these agreements in domestic courts.

item.title: 600,000 Inquiries, No Waiting

Examples include the trade negotiations with the USA (TTIP), regulations covering diverse products like vacuum cleaners and genetically modified food, and the oversight (or in some cases, control) of Member States’ financial decisions.

item.description: As a preliminary step in the restoration of a Beogram 4000 turntable, I chose to verify the functionality of its control system. Instead, it would travel to the center of the platter and stop. item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): New Gold Plated RCA Plugs
item.description: Over time, many Beogram devices have developed corroded DIN or RCA plugs. It’s a good idea to replace these old connectors with new, gold-plated ones. item.title: Should User Account Control be disabled?
item.description: Increasingly, as clients transition to Windows 7 or Vista, user account control issues are becoming more prevalent in Dynamics GP support, particularly with Dynamics GP Utilities. item.title: The Google Spain ruling by the CJEU: a lack of equilibrium between privacy and freedom of speech
item.description: By Steve Peers The EU’s data protection Directive was established in 1995 during the early days of the internet, before the rise of major internet companies. Notably, Google, founded in 1998, emerged just as EU countries were implementing this Directive. Despite its age and ongoing debates surrounding a proposed revision, this legislation still governs the modern internet. Years of debate about the Directive’s application to aspects like social media, search engines, and cookies culminated in the CJEU’s GoogleSpain judgment, focusing on search engines.

item.title: India and Bangladesh have initiated connectivity projects
item.description: The Prime Ministers of India and Bangladesh, Narendra Modi and Sheikh Hasina, respectively, along with West Bengal’s Chief Minister, Mamata Banerjee, inaugurated multiple connectivity initiatives between the two nations. item.title: Is Metro Ethernet Available?
item.description: When your company needs more bandwidth, you might wonder about your options. Metro Ethernet is a popular choice, often providing more bandwidth for less money than traditional telecommunications services. But is it available in your area? You can easily check availability using an Ethernet service finder to view a map of “lit” buildings nearby. item.title: BEAM offers self-storage services in Singapore through a mobile app
item.description: BEAM, a new self-storage company, has launched in Singapore, offering a unique approach to traditional storage solutions. Their services are managed entirely through a mobile app. Unlike conventional self-storage providers that lease fixed spaces, BEAM offers flexible per-item storage. This means users only pay for the space their belongings occupy, eliminating wasted costs. item.title: Delta is launching Delta Innovation Classes
Business Telephone Systems Hosted VoIP Advantages
item.description: Businesses of all sizes have various choices for their telephone systems. Small businesses can buy systems from local stores, while medium-sized businesses often work with contractors for key telephone systems or small PBXs. Larger companies may have internal teams that handle complex telephone systems. Nowadays, hosted VoIP is a cost-effective option for companies of all sizes. How can one solution meet the needs of different-sized businesses affordably? It’s not a one-size-fits-all solution but a scalable technology adaptable to different demands—hosted VoIP, also known as hosted PBX or cloud telephone systems.

item.title: What is the purpose of using the system password in Dynamics GP?
item.description: A client recently brought up the Dynamics GP System Password, a feature I find comparable to User Classes – widely used in the past but less common in modern implementations. For those unfamiliar, the System Password in Dynamics GP (found under Administration Page > Setup > System Password) safeguards all system menus (Setup, Cards, Reports, etc.) with a password. This means users need to enter the password to access these windows, even if they technically have permission.

item.title: Tableau offers free data visualization for iPad users
item.description: Tableau Software released Vizable, a free mobile app designed for iPad, that allows users to visualize and understand data. item.title: What qualities define exceptional training?
item.description: Over the past few weeks, I’ve been leading training sessions, including a Dynamics GP Distribution Partner Academy and a customized Forecaster training. These distinct classes got me thinking about the elements of exceptional training and what makes it truly valuable. I’d love to share my thoughts and hear yours! Relevant Content: It’s crucial for training content to align with student needs. item.title: Managed Hosting PBX Gets You Out Of The Telephone Business
item.description: A lot of businesses find themselves managing their own phone systems simply because they need phones to operate, even though it’s not their core business. This has become the norm, but it doesn’t have to be this way anymore. Companies previously invested in extensive phone systems because the productivity gains from each employee having a direct line outweighed the costs. In the past, a single phone line sufficed, but with the information age, constant communication became essential, driving the need for dedicated telecom departments.

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Restoration of the Main PCB and Installation of a Biasing Trimmer for TR3
item.description: After getting the Beogram 4002 (5513) operational again, I focused on fully restoring the main PCB. This involved installing a trimmer to correctly calibrate TR3, the transistor responsible for amplifying the signal from the record detection sensor. item.title: SmartList Builder and SQL Tables/Views
item.description: Many of you may already know this, but I encountered a problem this week deploying a SmartList Builder item. item.title: Technavio identifies luxury handbag brands worth keeping an eye on

item.title: Users of Forecaster and Dynamics GP
item.description: Have you ever encountered a problem where you vaguely recall a solution but can’t seem to locate the specific article or link? This happened to me recently with a client attempting to use their Dynamics GP user ID for Forecaster 7. As expected, it was unsuccessful due to GP’s encryption method when generating user IDs in SQL. This encryption prevents the same ID from functioning in Forecaster, even with proper database permissions.

item.title: 3x3 Mbps Ethernet Doubles Your Bandwidth
item.description: In today’s world, who couldn’t benefit from additional internet speed? Websites, software, and files continue to grow larger, but unfortunately, technology budgets haven’t kept pace. Imagine doubling your internet speed without increasing your current expenses – an appealing proposition, wouldn’t you agree? It might sound illogical to suggest that doubling your internet speed wouldn’t cost more, especially since internet providers aren’t known for giving things away for free. The secret lies in adopting newer, more cost-effective technology instead of simply replacing your existing service with an identical one from another provider.

item.title: The Asia Pacific region is experiencing the most rapid growth for SWIFT
item.description: SWIFT, a financial messaging service, has announced a significant increase in new corporate clients from the Asia Pacific region between May and December 2015, with 29 new companies joining the network. SWIFT provides a unified platform for corporations to communicate financial information with their banks globally, leading to enhanced visibility and more efficient treasury operations. This connection allows for greater automation and standardization of financial processes. Currently, over 1,500 corporate groups, representing roughly 30,000 entities, utilize SWIFT to manage their banking relationships worldwide.

item.title: IT Departments are Wearin' the Green
item.description: Maintaining IT budgets requires more than just good fortune these days. Many companies are discovering that environmentally friendly practices can save them money. These eco-conscious choices benefit both the planet and their bottom line. One of the first areas to examine is electricity consumption. Power usage can be deceptive because it often occurs in small, unnoticeable increments. Every desktop computer, even when idle, contributes to the overall energy use, measured in watt-hours and kilowatt-hours.

item.title: The discussion on drones in the UK and its impact on the European Union
item.description: By Chris Jones A new report, Back from the battlefield: domestic drones in the UK, investigates the use of drones by public and private entities in the UK. It focuses on law enforcement and border control agencies, examining the laws, regulations, and public and private funding surrounding drone technology development. The report analyzes the current situation and potential future applications, advocating for public discussion and decision-making before widespread drone use, particularly for surveillance, becomes commonplace.

item.title: The CJEU provides clarification on the applicable law and jurisdiction for data protection.
item.description: Lorna Woods, Professor of Internet Law, University of Essex* The Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) recently issued a decision in the Weltimmo case regarding the jurisdictional reach of data protection authorities. The court ruled that the authority of one Member State can exercise jurisdiction over entities primarily operating outside of that state’s borders. This ruling could impact two important issues being considered for the proposed data protection regulation: the regulation’s territorial scope and the authority of national data protection bodies.

item.title: Lit Buildings Have Near Infinite Bandwidth
item.description: By: John Shepler When choosing a business location, consider “lit buildings” for their exceptional connectivity. The term “lit” references the laser beams used to transmit digital signals at high speeds through fiber optic cables.

item.title: Is the European Border and Coast Guard a completely new entity or just a revamped version of Frontex?
item.description: Herbert Rosenfeldt, Research Assistant and PhD candidate, University of Passau Introduction Celebrating the new European Border and Coast Guard Agency, also known as Frontex, at the Bulgarian external border with Turkey might seem like an odd festivity. However, last Thursday, high-ranking EU and Member State officials gathered at Bulgaria’s Kapitan Andreevo Border Checkpoint for this inauguration. This event marked the implementation of the European Border and Coast Guard Regulation, a significant step towards strengthening external border control in the wake of recent migration challenges.

item.title: Is it possible to suspend Schengen due to Greece? Is it necessary to do so?
item.description: A recent leak of a Council document proposes a potential suspension of the Schengen system for a duration of up to two years. This proposal stems from what are being termed “systemic deficiencies” in Greece’s management of its external borders, particularly concerning the influx of refugees and migrants. Such a suspension would provide any Schengen country the option to reinstate or implement border controls along their shared internal borders. While it’s unlikely that every Schengen country would exercise this option, it’s anticipated that several would choose to do so, especially given that a number already have active border controls in place.

item.title: Are Your T1 Lines Saturated?
item.description: By: John Shepler The perfect network connection is invisible. Whether it uses copper wires, coaxial cable, fiber optics, or wireless technology, if it impacts your network traffic, it’s not truly transparent. The more noticeable these limitations become, the more they hinder productivity, demanding your attention. Artificial Limitations Shared broadband services like Cable, DSL, 4G Cellular, or satellite internet, despite promising “best effort,” are inherently limited by technology and company policies. Each type has a maximum capacity, typically accessible round-the-clock, except for rare outages.

item.description: By: John Shepler Have you found that your internet service, once reliable, can no longer keep up with your growing business? item.title: What Is Toll Free?
item.description: The term “toll free number” is widely recognized, with most people having used one. But what exactly does it mean and how do businesses acquire them? Unlike standard phone numbers automatically assigned with landline, VoIP, or cellular services, toll free numbers require a separate process. In the US and Canada, phone numbers follow the North American Numbering Plan (NANP) format: 1-NPA-NXX-XXXX. In this format, “1” represents the country code, NPA stands for Numbering Plan Area (area code), and the remaining digits are unique to your line.

item.title: The Legal Standing of a Third Country before the CJEU: AG Hogan's Opinion in Case C‑872/19 P Venezuela v Council in Relation to State Immunity and Comity
item.description: Eva Kassoti, Senior Researcher, CLEER academic co-ordinator, T.M.C. Asser Institute. E-mail: E.Kassoti@asser.nl In a legal opinion issued on February 20, 2021, Advocate General Hogan addressed a crucial procedural issue: Can a non-EU country legally challenge EU actions before the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU)? This question holds significance because the Court has never directly ruled on it within the context of sanctions, and it delves into the principles governing the relationship between EU law and other international law subjects.

item.title: NIST has chosen the SHA-3 cryptographic hash.
item.description: The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) has chosen the “Keccak” algorithm as the new SHA-3 cryptographic hash algorithm.
